website_summaries.verdict: If you have a large budget for a TV that will impress, this LG model offers a huge screen, remarkable OLED picture quality, and responsive smart technology.
pros: A serious TV enthusiast's dream, as it has impeccable 4K and OLED display, large 77-inch screen, reliable smart capabilities, and the brand's Al ThinQ technology
Perfect for creating a home theater that rivals any cinema
cons: The extremely high price of this OLED smart TV will put it out of reach for many consumers

website_summaries.verdict: Every feature, from the amazing picture quality to the intuitive smart technology, is likely to impress. However, this large-screen TV won't fit everyone's budget.
pros: Offers LG's OLED technology combined with 4K for awesome colors and contrasts
Delivers a fast refresh rate and decent sound
Al ThinQ technology and voice remote add state-of-the-art technology to your viewing experience

website_summaries.verdict: If your budget isn't a concern, the huge screen, awe-inspiring image quality, and smart technology this OLED TV offers will add excitement to your viewing pleasure.
pros: Extra-large 77-inch screen makes images come to life - almost like being in a movie theater
Colors are vibrant and have excellent contrast thanks  to the 4K resolution
Sound is good, and it's even better when you add a speaker or soundbar
Intuitive smart capabilities including viewer recognition AI ThinQ and responsive apps
cons: Very expensive - more than two or three times the price of others in its class by LG

customer_reviews.title: Do not allow Amazon techs to touch when they deliver!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The people Amazon issues to deliver this stuff actually stripped every. Single. Screw. In the TV. They also managed to break a piece of plastic while attempting to man handle the thing..... One guy actually tried to use an electric drill to fasten the Phillips screws. I had to stop them at that point Omfg, Amazon, just use ups for the love of all that's holy. Your "special" delivery people suck!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: erin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought I couldn't go wrong with this TV after reading the professional reviews but was disappointed. While I loved the contrast and the AI operating system, the image clarity was very poor. I tried all the different setting adjustments to correct this with no luck. I have since learned that image sharpness is a common issue with QLED TV's. I have replaced it with a Samsung UN8000 with outstanding clarity and decent contrast.
customer_reviews.author: NorthghostTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Screen. Surround sound is a lie..
customer_reviews.text: So, fantastic screen.. though I bought the base level and later upgraded to this model because I like high quality sound and this model has an atmos capable processor... EXCEPT, they don't tell you that this is limited to built in speakers, which are basically terrible on just about any tv ever made. There is no means to send a dolby signal to anything but the built in speakers. So, my investment in a ysp-5600 beast of a soundbar was essentially wasted. LG customer service doesn't seem to care. So be forewarned... LG is essentially lying about their product.
customer_reviews.author: A Rivas

customer_reviews.title: This is the TV you've been looking for
customer_reviews.text: True to the commercial reviews, this is a great TV. I have the C7 which was great and the slight improvements the C8 gives are worth it. Picture is excellent. HDMI CEC integration is nicely functional. Alexa control is a bit clunky but it works spot on as long as you remember to say "Alexa, ask LG to.." beforehand. No compromises I could find and I have no regrets or complaints - either with the TV or buying it on Amazon Marketplace.
customer_reviews.author: LLWarrenP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent TV
customer_reviews.text: Calibration is a challenge as you have to defeat all the build it tools. LG thinks they are smarter than a proper calibration. If the input changes from Dolby Vision to standard HDR, the TV sets a different profile. There does not seem to be a way to stop this. You have to recalibrate the profile it chooses. Once calibrated, the picture is beautiful. The bigger issue is the choice LG picks. I find this annoying, but not a show stopper.
customer_reviews.author: RonV2

customer_reviews.title: HDMI input failed after 2 days of use
customer_reviews.text: Thank heavens we bought this from Amazon. Great picture and sound but after 2 days of use the HDMI it could no longer receive HDMI input from the TiVo, or another TiVo - even with a replacement HDMI cable. Too spooked to try a replacement unit. We'll continue using our old TV until these are more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I was unlucky, maybe this is indicative of poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: This is the second defective TV I've purchased through Amazon. This one had a large internal crack and always turns on for a few milliseconds and then shuts off. I'm just glad I didn't have to go through LG's god awful customer support to get a refund. So far, buying TVs online has been a terrible experience.
customer_reviews.author: Buster

customer_reviews.title: Quality TV
customer_reviews.text: Nevermind 4K, it's the OLED that makes this stand out. If you have ever used an OLED phone you know why it's so much better. True blacks, vibrant colors. Both my Xbox One X and PS4 look fantastic with this. Definitely a sharper image on the standard PS4 despite it not handling 4K. The magic remote is a must-have, and webOS is much more fluid and snappy than any other TV UI I've used. Worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonbot

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: The picture is amazing. The only think I'm not 100% sold on is that it doesn't seem bright enough in our sunny living room during the day. At night it's amazing.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: I was excited, but then then...
customer_reviews.text: Edges were bent. The TV did not turn on. I noticed a big line on the screen. I did not even bother to get a replacement since the year is just around the corner. I will probably get the upcoming model. Very impractical when it comes to mounting on the wall. Hopefully they come up with something better.
customer_reviews.author: Hakeristi

customer_reviews.title: Shipped with politically correct energy saving setting?
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was really disappointed by the dim picture. After a very frustrating 2 hours of exploring and tweaking options I was ready to ship the TV back, then I discovered that that the energy saving option was set on. Now that the energy saving option is set off the picture is outstanding. It is something to check if the initial picture looks dim.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B. James

customer_reviews.title: Theatre quality (minus the expensive popcorn)
customer_reviews.text: An excellent tv. Outstanding graphics, great functionality, loads of features! Movie theatre quality, all the way. *Very* pleased, in that (a month later) I'm still stunned by the immersive nature of vision and sound.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S. Sappington

customer_reviews.title: Great screen impossible software
customer_reviews.text: Operating this TV is worse then flying an airplane. The software and remote make no sense
customer_reviews.author: ron friedman

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this TV used, trust me!! Went out after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this tv used!! Trust me. Went out after 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Colby Neal

customer_reviews.title: Best TV quality ive seen
customer_reviews.text: Great TV! Picture looks super clear and detailed... only scary part is unboxing this thing. The screen thickness is so slim. Make sure to read the setup instructions so you don’t break it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture, decent sound
customer_reviews.text: Yes, these TV’s are crazy expensive, yes - everything I read about OLED is true, the picture is amazing. Haven’t had 4K yet but 1080p is stunning. Remote doesn’t work with my cable box (google fiber) which is a minor annoyance. Lots of language around terms and conditions which makes me believe LG is selling my viewing habits, but since my viewing habita are supremely boring not too concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Fritts

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful picture
customer_reviews.text: Wow. That's the first word that will come to you when you first see it. Wow! I'm not a big fan of the control interface; you can get to where you are trying to get to. And often in a couple of different ways; but the remote control makes it a little difficult for less technically inclined folks. And if you're looking for a comprehensive user manual, forget it; there isn't any such critters. You have to figure out the menu's all on your own. On screen help is fair, and does actually assist with good information. Overall, no regrets, it's a great TV with a few minor complaints wrt the HMI. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable picture and love the "smart" features
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I've been missing out. I'm upgrading from a Sharp Aquos Quatron LED (which was a really great TV for its time) and I have to say it's like night and day. The color on this TV is unreal. I've not seen a picture like this other than a Sony model at BB that was $1500 more. And the "smart" features are really cool. From the web browser to screen mirroring and all the other stuff, it's been really fun. Netflix and Prime load almost instantly. And it plays very well with my surround sound system (once I chose the right sound output option). Props to LG. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: this is a keeper
customer_reviews.text: the setup went flawlessly.This tv is amazing.It's got every option available.It's got a gorgeous picture,which is fully adjustable to what anyone could want.The first one I got was defective.Amazon straightened it out immediately and sent me a replacement.Just waiting now for UPS to pick it up.All return charges covered by amazon.I was holding my breath when I first turned it on...but it worked perfectly.The first one had a line going vertically down the center with a small sliver of the display.When it went to the screen,it wouldn't stay on.VERY satisfied with Amazon on this and this TV...it's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: H2

customer_reviews.title: Television arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.text: The television arrived damaged. It seemed like a bargain, but perhaps it was too good to be true. I’m not sure if I trust buying a tv online anymore.
customer_reviews.author: ProgJulie

customer_reviews.title: Constantly turned itself off after a couple of minutes!
customer_reviews.text: I got the unit as a present for my father about a month ago, it worked normally for about a week or two before he complained about it shutting off by itself intermittently! I've tried everything recommended to stop it, but to no avail. I noticed that there's irregularities in the upper left corner of the unit, what looks like melting! The screen shows distortion in the area of the deformation. I know that a certain percentage of products are defective from the start and this was an unfortunate event from a brand that's otherwise been great. Update, returned the unit for a new one, no issues since.
customer_reviews.author: Bronze247

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you can return for free
customer_reviews.text: I got a garbage panel. Thankfully I usually order from Amazon fulfilled and can drop it back off at ups. After that I went to Costco and bought one for their liberal return policy and extended warranty deal. Plus it was 50 dollars cheaper.. just had to pay tax. Well worth it for a damn near flawless panel after this mess
customer_reviews.author: william dean miller

customer_reviews.title: You can not get Direct TV now on this TV
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this TV expecting a really easy smart TV and it is only half smart. You can get Netflix and Amazon but forget Direct TV now. There is no way to get an app for this and without this my use is pretty limited. I either go back to a box connected to the TV and pay big bucks for service or live with a very limited content. For the price you pay you should get full smart TV. But is does have a great picture.
customer_reviews.author: Fish Pictures

customer_reviews.title: Simply unreal picture
customer_reviews.text: The color of shots in HDR mode on this screen look exactly like they did when I was looking at them through a Barco projector during dailies.
customer_reviews.author: Shidarin

customer_reviews.title: New and not working
customer_reviews.text: Damaged out the box. Black line through. Called LG and they said return to the dealer.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Aviles

customer_reviews.title: Sports are soooo much better
customer_reviews.text: Whether you like golf, soccer, football or other outdoor sport, UHD is the way to go. The guy who installed it had trouble leveling it. The cause was not the TV. IT was either the wall mount or the installer, or both. I haven't used too many of the smart features. I have an Apple TV and DirectTV. From the small amount of playing around with setting up and configuration, you could watch a lot of TV if you have internet available, and accounts with Amazon Prime, Hulu, or Netflix. Smart features are based upon Google mostly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful image and interface
customer_reviews.text: The interface and smoothness of everything is very nice. Everything flows without stutter, so you can tell the processors going to work are pretty high tech behind the picture you see. The image itself is unbeatable. I will say with how thin (and expensive) the display is it was a little nerve-wracking carrying it or moving it anywhere as I felt one wrong move could break it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rogler

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my 1080P 56" Samsung. Great picture. It has a very low-profile design when hung on the wall. The smart TV apps for LG work very well and are comparative to the updated apps seen on the Roku, Nvidia Shield, and Amazon FireTV 4k. I so far have only been able to test out the picture using streaming sources like Vudu, Netflix, Prime Video, and YouTube. I look forward to seeing what the 4K Blu-ray material looks like when I get a compatible player. 1080 sources look great as well. The built in speakers are good for built in speakers. I would not rely on them to give me a home theater audio experience though.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Silverstein

customer_reviews.title: One bad ass TV.
customer_reviews.text: This TV is so life like that the cat stalked the on-screen birds while viewing Blue Planet II on Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: Quality not up to 2018 standards
customer_reviews.text: Was dissapointed in the price-to-quality ratio. For the amount of money, expected better. The smart TV wasn't as smart as other models from LG that I bought in 2015 & 2016. And it has a difficult time detecting inputs of video game system that you have to turn the video game system on/off a couple times for the TV to recognize the input. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: CrimsonOrange

customer_reviews.title: This is the definitive OLED TV of its generation
customer_reviews.text: Even though TV manufacturers are full-hog into smart TVs, adding all sorts of AI and stuff these day. The only thing I really wish is for this TV to be dumber. The thick layer of manufacturer software and applications on top of the normal configuration and menus make the experience for this TV lesser on the whole. The manufacturers are incetivized to stop updating the software once a newer model comes out so, so the TV experience suffers on purpose and you are forced into buying a new model.
customer_reviews.author: Fuse

customer_reviews.title: Remote does not support IR
customer_reviews.text: I can't control the volume on my SOSOS system with this remote because it does not send an IR signal making the remote worthless to me. The TV has no IR out so I'm forced to buy some crappy universal remote or work the tv using one remote for volume and the other for everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Frese

customer_reviews.title: Great TV Exactly what I was expecting except for Sonos Beam Issue
customer_reviews.text: Worked great out of the box. Have been a long time Samsung TV owner. This LG just blew us away. The only caveat so far is an incompatibility between the Sonos Beam and the C8. There are audio lags between that two that there does not seem to be a solution for. It only happens with Live TV. Netflix and other streaming services don't appear to have the problem. Right now we are using it with the LG Internal speakers, until I find a solution of LG and Sonos come out with an update.
customer_reviews.author: HomeAutomationNerd

customer_reviews.title: Unreasonably HIGH Price
customer_reviews.text: Clarity of the picture amazes. Like most TV's quality of sound has room for improvement: so no need for sound bar. Price is unreasonably high.
customer_reviews.author: Thoughtful

customer_reviews.title: this is a very expensive cheaply made television
customer_reviews.text: This television lasted 31 days before going out. Had to wait five days for a repair person to come to the house and "diagnosis" the problem and now have to wait another 10 days for them to order the parts which includes a new screen. They say don't worry sir you're covered with the full LG warranty. Seems like they charge a lot of money using a lot of inferior foreign parts. I went to a local yard sale and bought a used RCA for $100 and it works great. Caveat Emptor!
customer_reviews.author: Rich Key West

customer_reviews.title: Burned in after less than 2 years - CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC
customer_reviews.text: Loved this TV until it developed this problem about 2 months ago. We bought it in November 2018. We don't watch CNN all day, just now and then, usually we're watching movies on Netflix or History Channel shows. You can see in the photos where the CNN banner has burned in - you can even read "CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC" in the banner! I knew when I bought it that other reviewers had complained about this, but I thought I could overlook it if it happened. However, it's really hard to overlook a green stripe that says CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC - it usually falls on the chin of the person shown - not a good look for an expensive TV.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Superb TV after a year of daily use (no burn-in)
customer_reviews.text: No burn-in! Take advantage of the screensaver and don’t leave CNN on all day. The overall quality is superb and the 4K HDR quality is gorgeous. I VERY CAREFULLY clean the screen softly with a small lint-free microfiber cloth. It’s not a high-maintenance TV but requires just a bit more care than your average LCD. Give it the love it deserves and you’ll have that beautiful picture quality to be thankful for. I use mine for streaming shows, movies, and playing video games.
customer_reviews.author: Happy customer

customer_reviews.title: Best pictuce quality you will ever see.
customer_reviews.text: The hype is real I have heard some people talk about how awesome the oled tv picture is but I decided to watch it for a bit before doing a review, there is just something different about watching a oled tv the picture feels like its stimulating my senses like I am actually there. The deep blacks is what separate this from a led tv it just makes the picture so much more realistic, The negative is that I dont want to get up when I start watching the tv and I have stuff to do.
customer_reviews.author: mrv

customer_reviews.title: Love this television.
customer_reviews.text: I waited for this television to come out and have not been disappointed! The picture clarity is incredible and the sound amazing. The smart features make it simplistic to activate Netflix, Amazon Prime, and all other subscription channels, just go to the apps page and download. The TV tells you when there's an update. The voice activation feature pulls up all the channels that are showing whichever movie you asked it to search for. The Bluetooth feature hooks up effortlessly to my soundbar and speakers.
customer_reviews.author: C Bear

customer_reviews.title: BEAST
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality of this tv is a "BEAST".........Like being at the Movies in my Bed......How Sweet!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon E.

customer_reviews.title: Best TV I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is literally one of the best TVs I've ever seen. Definitely the best that I've ever owned. OLED is just above and beyond any of the other available technologies in the TV world. The only downside is that it doesn't get as bright as some of the other backlit LCD TVs. That can make viewing a little difficult if your room is very bright. I was worried about the often mentioned issue of screen burn-in. After a year and a half of ownership, I have noticed absolutely no burn-in issues whatsoever. I'm guessing that it could still happen if someone watches static pictures and television icons for excessively long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Impressive display
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this TV about six months ago and i've been very happy with it since. It replaced an older 1080p unit from years past and the difference in picture quality is quite stunning. Mostly used via an xbox one, it provides a rich and immersive experience for games, movies and tv shows all at 4k. Lightweight and easy to mount, my only raised eyebrow was upon realizing the mount points were much lower than my last TV, leaving it higher on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: A. Radin

customer_reviews.title: 4.8/5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the picture quality. This is the first OLED and 65” I’ve ever owned and The 4k content looks phenomenal. The blacks are near perfect and the User Interface/remote were both great. My biggest complaint is the lack of applications on LG content store- but this is pretty insignificant if you use an AppleTV or similar to stream high quality content. I’ve had no issues with burn in and have noticed in my apartment with the blinds up I do need to crack the brightness to max. Other than that I absolutely love this TV for the $1800 price I got... (Check out “Our Planet” on Netflix!)
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: True to life picture
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful TV and good sounds as well! I highly recommend Setting it up with two people because the screen is so thin it makes the TV feels flimsy or it might make you feel like you can break it, but once you set it up it’s a picture to behold it is actually good TV.
customer_reviews.author: Maher

customer_reviews.title: The best with the Sony 800. Best with satellite broad casts.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my home. Bought the 2018 Sam Q8 for my home away. Hands down this is the business. Satellite on both, this gives the best picture at 10" larger. 4K is comparable. Ordinary broadcasts and Blu-rays are where this shines. A few tweeks and I'm proud to have the family over to veiw anything. Its perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Stanly

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality
customer_reviews.text: Little pricey but well worth it. My old LG lasted 12 years. Amazing picture and very easy to use. Almost wish I would have went 65" but couldn't do that price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy L. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Hot TV Bummer (ONLY TV was included in the box) 😁
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in July of 2019, but haven't unboxed it until now as I had to move from Phoenix back to Canada for a while. BIG MISTAKE! TV didn't include remote, cables, manual, and, well, literally EVERYTHING minus the TV itself. I don't know what to do, since it's passed the return date with Amazon. I pretty much have to deal with LG tech support. NOTE TO SELF: check that all parts are included after you receive it...
customer_reviews.author: Guy Incognito

customer_reviews.title: LG Electronics OLED55C8P 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart OLED TV (2018 Model)
customer_reviews.text: Investigated @ Best Buy - bought on Amazon. Happy with the purchase. LG sound quality on this level of tv is pathetic!! Ended up buying a new receiver & subwoofer to connect an existing set of surround sound speakers that were already installed. Would have been cheaper to get a sound bar. 🤨
customer_reviews.author: ddilly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent TV
customer_reviews.text: Excellent picture quality right out of the box! A little too bright, to the point that the closed captioning, when in white, hurt my eyes; but turning down the brightness from about 88 to 73 helped a ton. Only complaint was a little vertical band in about 20% gray on the left hand side on the screen but only noticable when changing screens on Amazon app and hasn't had any impact on any show thus far. Will try the pixel refresh to see if it clears up. Definitely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: A. Whitwam

customer_reviews.title: One of the best TV in Market but not for me
customer_reviews.text: We had to return it as there is not enough brightness and 55 inch TV looks like 50. Needs improvement for design and remote. Picture quality was awesome during Nighttime but not during daylight. Otherwise, this is the best TV out in market at this time of LG improves brightness and sharpeners of the picture by reducing darkness.
customer_reviews.author: 11MVP11

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Product.
customer_reviews.text: Had this tv for almost a year really good tv. My only complaint is that the arc stoped working a month in. Picture is of the chain my magic remote is broken but I use a urc remote. Just ordered the 2019 C9 really looking forward to receiving that. To be honest once you go oled you can’t go back to led/lcd. Only thing I worry about is burn in but so far I’ve not seen any on my B6 and C8.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best picture I've ever seen while watching movies!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic picture for movies and most video games. But, some lower framerate video games will show some judder and become blurry during movement in the game. As of now there's no way to make it run smoother during lower framerates, seeing as it doesn't have a variable refresh rate.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, but disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Gorgeous picture. Very sharp and bright. The Magic Remote Control and Smart features are outstanding. Cons: Developed a spot of stuck bright white pixels after less than three weeks usage. For such a high $$, high tech item, I would never expect a defect of that type. Should have been caught in QC when "exercising" the panel prior to factory boxing. Appears to be a faulty transistor. One more pro: Amazon did a wonderful job with the refund. The one star review applies to LG, not Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: BRANDON F.

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality, totally worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from Samsung plasma to this. Picture quality is excellent, totally love it! But LG WebOS is a bit lacking in that it doesn't have all the apps like HBO Go, DirecTV Now etc which then requires me to continue to use my old Fire TV Cube to access those apps. Also yet to figure out the voice control in Google assistant to switch on the tv.
customer_reviews.author: JDLA

customer_reviews.title: You’ll get the picture with this TV
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best TVs on the market for 4K OLED. The picture is phenomenal and its physical appearance is sleek and modern. Colors are vivid and its blacks are true. One thing to keep in mind with this TV: it’s extremly fragile. It’s depth in some areas is less than a quarter of an inch, which makes it flimsy. Moving the TV, much less hanging it, is a nerve racking endevour.
customer_reviews.author: tboe

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome TV; the picture is incredible. I am still learning all the smart features but you don't need to know everything tojust watch TV. You can learn as you go.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture quality
customer_reviews.text: This tv is great for gaming and any tv shows that you like to watch. I’ve read articles and watched videos saying the brightness isn’t that bright but I disagree. This tv has the best picture of any tv I have ever watched hands down. I got mine for a little less than $2000. If you can find it new for that price or less don’t hesitate, buy it I promise you will not be disappointed. I highly recommend getting a 4k fire stick to use with it.
customer_reviews.author: RedBusa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Picture
customer_reviews.text: I buy electronics like this based on Consumer Reports recommendations. This was one of their higher rated TVs for the size I wanted. I am thrilled with the quality of the TV itself, picture and sound. It was very easy to set up. I have had no problems with the "smart" remote. My only, relatively minor quibble -- the TV remote won't turn on/off my cable box. I still need the second remote for this -- I'm not sure why. Would highly recommend this set to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Lou R

customer_reviews.title: Best picture but expensive
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the lgc8 65 inch oled but they sent me the c9 which is the current oled model Very expensive but it's the best picture you can get. I have 16mb att internet service which helps. The only. Thing I don't like is no annoying software doing things all the time. I tried turning off the software but then I couldn't stream!
customer_reviews.author: Russell J. Christie

customer_reviews.title: Box was bug hotel
customer_reviews.text: Dear Amazon I don’t know where this TV was stored but since opening the box I have found numerous roaches, a centipede, and a scorpion. Thankfully, having lived in Hawaii, I knew not to touch them so no injuries. Thought you should know. The next buyer may not be so informed.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Naughton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tv
customer_reviews.text: By far the best bang for you buck in 4k tvs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good TV
customer_reviews.text: Its a great TV overall. The Good- 4k programs look very good, easy to use, and design is nice. The not so good- Very little 4k content available without add ons, Sports extreamaly rare in 4k, and most programs are still not available in 4k, so not getting full use of it. Overall Its a great TV and I am happy so far with the purchase. If I was buying a new TV right now I would choose this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Failed after three weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this TV - beautiful picture, sound, features; but after just three weeks of normal use, a vertical green line from top to bottom of screen appeared. I tried everything to correct, but nothing helped. Thanks to Amazon's 30 day return policy, I returned TV for a full refund. Now what do I do? Take a chance on another LG or start all over looking at competing vendors. At this point all I want is a hassle-free TV with a decent picture - doesn't have to be outstanding as the LG was when it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Marino

customer_reviews.title: Probably the world's best TV.
customer_reviews.text: The picture is unbelievable. It's got so many options and settings, etc., it will take me months to learn everything. And I should say this replaced a great TV - 2010 Panasonic plasma TV that had a great picture. I just wanted to update to get the new smart features. NOTE: Don't overspend for this. The price has come way down. I got my 55" for $ 1220., not including the extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Monaghan

customer_reviews.title: Wow !
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is amazing, the color is rich and vibrant. Worth every dollar, spoil yourself. Love is this TV.
customer_reviews.author: smarty-pets

customer_reviews.title: Great TV at a reasonable price for OLED
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived without any defects. It took a a little bit of customization to optimize picture settings (standard leaves a lot to be desired) but really impressed. Maybe it’s because I’m upgrading from an older TV or don’t use a home theater system, but I thought the sound on the TV was better than some of the negative reviews hear make it out to be. Updated Oct 2020: Nearly two years now and no issue with burn in. That’s with frequent video games and quite a bit of news. Plus, software is updated pretty regularly. No surprises here - smooth sailing.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great tv
customer_reviews.text: Really love this tv. I watch a lot of tv, Netflix, Amazon prime and play all 3 major gaming consoles. No dead pixels, none of that burn in people talk about.
customer_reviews.author: John the black

customer_reviews.title: Picture is incredible; WiFi is horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Love the picture! Hate the WiFi. Picture is awesome (once you turn off all the stupid energy saving crap)! Nothing else comes close to an OLED. Unlike every other smart device in my home, this TV cannot seem to remember the WiFi password and wants the password reentered every single time you turn it on. It's a major PITA. I would rate it 5 stars if it wasn't for this very annoying glitch.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic TV. Deep rich colors !
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a huge difference from the previous LG TV we purchased. Our previous LG TV was 4K LED, this one is OLED. There is a huge difference in the picture quality and colors. The OLED is dramatic and definitely worth the extra price.
customer_reviews.author: Don Y

customer_reviews.title: Best tv I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best tv I've owned (and yes, it isn't the first model I've owned). Picture quality is the main selling point and it does not disappoint. The UI also is very fast and much more stable than something like the Android OS (looking at you, Sony). The magic remote also is very easy to use. I can highly recommend this tv for the enthusiast tv/movie viewer, gamer and everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service from LG
customer_reviews.text: Product works great when it works. Had issues under warranty where the tv would turn off and wouldn't power on for a day or so since about 3 months after purchase. Lg rejected my requests to replace with no explanation. Now, after 1year it has powered off for good.
customer_reviews.author: K.W

customer_reviews.title: Im so, so satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Love tv, love it!! I did not hang it on the wall, so the tv stand had to be screwed into the very flat screen. I was not expecting that. The instructions are horrible! Lucky I was able to figure it out on my own! The instructions are just magnified pictures?? Comes in a very huge box (55”)
customer_reviews.author: Gabby Li

customer_reviews.title: Great tv!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this tv! I replaced my 10 year old lg with this one. There is absolutely no comparison in picture quality. I did my research and the LG OLED’s are ranked the best in every category. It was fairly easy to setup. I recommend viewing the YouTube videos unless you are already knowledgeable about the setup of LG’s OLED tv’s. I also purchased the sound bar because the tv’s sound alone is not very good. Also it makes sense; if you are going to use this tv for movies, the sound bar is essential to achieve the full effect of the movie. I highly recommend this ty.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: Love it. great picture, so many features. Just amazing. No problems. Only gripe is with the remote. Why don't they make ALL remotes that light up ??? I can't tell which button is which in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Love the LG OLED 55-inch TV
customer_reviews.text: My first generation Samsung got fried when my house was struck by lightning recently, so I had to get a new flat screen for the den. Was looking at the Samsung again, but found the LG color to be much better. Love that the picture goes all the way to the edge too. Haven't perfected using the remote to get connected to my internet to use the smart features yet, but hopefully will get that set up.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi S.

customer_reviews.title: For those on the fence
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of buying 3rd party so for those who also are hesitant I'm writing this review. Purchased the TV, then after a week i was contacted by Seko who handles the shipping. They scheduled a delivery with me. I Installed the TV and so far it's been perfect. Will update review after I've had it 90 days but so far I'm a believer.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Simmons

customer_reviews.title: As good as all the reviews (here and elsewhere) say
customer_reviews.text: It really is awesome without much settings tinkering required. Slim, easy to mount (amazon pro services is great), easy to use, etc. I'm no ultra techy guy who will talk about wavelengths and RBG and all that stuff, but I do know it's a great TV. A little pricey, but this should last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Picture...Picture...Picture
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for the best quality picture in a 4K HDR TV, then you need to buy this OLED TV. Picture quality is remarkable. Dolby Vision and Atmos quality is quality like I have ever seen. This TV will just get better with content upgrade to 4K HDR/Dolby Vision streaming. The only thing I wish was better was more apps to download to the TV with more streaming services. Really hate that HBO GO App is NOT on this TV. Overall, this TV still gets 5 stars, because the picture is so life changing. Entertainment to the max!
customer_reviews.author: Symaron L. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Great tv with amazing picture
customer_reviews.text: Brightness is the only thing that can be an issue for some... in bright rooms this TV can seem dim. and in Dim rooms you might want to turn down the brightness... would be ideal to have better control of this for use. However they brightness being lowered also helps stop Burn in so there is a tradeoff.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: They could definitely streamline setting up the services - it really should just be done from your phone. But once it's setup, it is great.
customer_reviews.author: SMB

customer_reviews.title: Vertical Banding!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture. Interface is great. I don't leave many reviews, but I'm so frustrated trying to figure out what to do with the vertical banding. Very frustrating with a TV that costs over 3k.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Alexa or Android app
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying this TV in hopes you can control it with the Amazon Echo device, go elsewhere. The skill in the Alexa section has been completely abandoned and your TV will not be discovered. The Android LG app is no better.
customer_reviews.author: Bleeding edge adopter

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: This was a 2018 model TV purchased on Amazon through a third party supplier (authorized dealer). I purchased it for a great price and have had no issues with the TV. It has a very sharp picture and has really shown what it can do when I play 4K DVD's. The sound quality is very good and I have not even considered linking it to my adjacent stereo system, although I am sure I will take a look at that in the future. Everything has gone very smoothly including delivery. It is everything I had hoped for when purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: This TV is good, OLED displays are the best
customer_reviews.text: I have both the 2017 and 2018 models of this TV, they are both great. I switched to OLED for both my tv and phone (iPhone X) 2 years ago, and Now lcd displays, even the highest end ones seem all wrong. The only legitimate reasons to buy something else are cost and burn in. And the susceptibility of OLED displays to burn in has declined steadily since the earliest 2016 models. It seems like 2017 and later models are on course to have pretty high average life spans.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Smith

customer_reviews.title: Might be the single best big purchase item I've ever made.
customer_reviews.text: Might be the single best big purchase item I've ever made. I kept waffling on getting a budget TV vs OLED, but after doing a cost breakdown of Film/TV consumption, I decided to plop down the money. It was worth it. I've never seen a picture this good. It's insane.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing TV
customer_reviews.text: Blacks are so black, the screen looks like it's turned off. 4k is so sharp, 1080p looks blurry now.
customer_reviews.author: Power User

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic picture quality. Only issue I have is with the remote; I have been unsuccessful in pairing it to control a Yamaha Soundbar. Have read about others who have had the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Monte S.

customer_reviews.title: Incredible picture, no burn in after 1 year of use.
customer_reviews.text: This TV is absolutely amazing. The picture quality blew me out of the water the first time I saw it, and it still amazes me to this day. I have had it for over 1 year and have no burn in. I use the TV weekly for watching HDR movies. TIP: Use the "Lower Power Saving" mode in the settings, this will reduce the brightness just a little and may increase the lifespan of the OLED screen. If you watch movies in a somewhat dark room the lower power saving setting still looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Dimitri

customer_reviews.title: Just like picture
customer_reviews.text: Was a great deal. A guy came with tv and put it up and programmed tv. Very happy and best picture ever.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene  Budde

customer_reviews.title: LG Electronics OLED65C8P 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart OLED TV
customer_reviews.text: I've had this TV for nearly a month now and I love it. I purchased a sound bar combo for it and still haven't connected it yet because the sound quality is excellent. I would highly recommend this TV to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy56

customer_reviews.title: Does not support Apple platforms.
customer_reviews.text: If the plan is to use this tv to steam Apple products, do not buy. The only way to stream apple apps on this is to buy an Apple box. Waste of money .
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Serious wow on this TV
customer_reviews.text: It's worth the cost, this TV is the best out there right now
customer_reviews.author: Dan M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing TV!
customer_reviews.text: This TV is amazing. Extremely easy to setup and connect gaming systems etc to it. The picture quality is perfect and I haven't ran into any issues at all. I highly recommend this TV, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Avara

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: My favorite TV. Easy to set up. Needs 2 people but very simple to assemble. It is everything you expected
customer_reviews.author: janet k

customer_reviews.title: Picture not crisp, complicated remote
customer_reviews.text: I steered from my usual Samsung to buy this as it was rated best by Consumer Reports. Picture not nearly as bright and crisp as on Samsung. TV is exceptionally thin if you are wall-mounting. I wish I had stuck with Samsung
customer_reviews.author: Shannon L Van Deren

customer_reviews.title: Great TV - no surprises
customer_reviews.text: Everything that I expected. This picture is so good it is a little disconcerting - I am used to washed-out colors and grays rather than deep blacks.
customer_reviews.author: BHH

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great picture, brighter than the Samsung plasma it replaced which is good because we have a very bright living room. Same great viewing angles as the plasma, but no 3D. Come on LG, some of us liked 3D.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R. Field

customer_reviews.title: Great Picture
customer_reviews.text: The picture is so vivid and I like the ease of settings.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Frank J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Slow to get repair done
customer_reviews.text: Have only had the TV for 6 weeks and it stopped working after 10 days. Still waiting for LG to send placement part for repair. Very disappointing that LG is so slow to get this repair done in a timely manner. Really, LG?
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: Great screen quality. One problem with "true black color" is those dark part of screen acts like mirror, which can be distracting. It helped when propped to tilt. Otherwise a great product.
customer_reviews.author: NKG

product_meta.title: LG Electronics OLED77C8PUA 77-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart OLED TV (2018 Model)
product_meta.description:
Size:77-Inch| Style:TV

The sleek C8 is designed to elevate a room’s aesthetics while complementing any decor. This new LG OLED TV with AI (Artificial Intelligence) ThinQ becomes the hub for the smart home: Using Intelligent Voice control, speak into the LG Magic Remote to pull up family photos, control light settings, check the weather and more. Movies, sports and games come to thrilling new life, more immersive with the perfect black and intense color made possible by LG OLED display technology. The new α9 (Alpha9) Intelligent Processor makes the most of the self-illuminating pixels, providing true-to-life images with rich colors, superior sharpness and enhanced depth. The C8 features comprehensive support of major 4K high dynamic range formats including premium Dolby Vision, as well as HDR10 and HLG.

*Service limited to certain languages. Some features require 3rd party service subscription.
*Dolby Vision is a trademark of Dolby Laboratories.
*Dolby, Dolby Atmos and the double-D symbol are registered trademarks of Dolby Laboratories.
feature_bullets: LG OLED TV with AI (Artificial Intelligence) ThinQ has the Google Assistant built in, so you can control compatible smart home devices using just your voice through the LG Magic Remote. Create a center for your smart home and beyond. Plus it works with Amazon Alexa devices (sold separately)

The α9 Intelligent Processor inside the LG OLED TV with AI ThinQ is the most powerful ever from LG. Developed exclusively for LG OLED TV, the new α9 processor noticeably enhances sharpness and depth while delivering vastly more accurate colors, for the ultimate in picture quality

Pixel Level Dimming enables each of the 8.3 million individually lit pixels of the LG OLED TV with AI ThinQ to brighten, dim or power off completely, achieving perfect black and displaying a level of picture detail impossible with any other television technology

4K Cinema HDR on LG OLED TV with AI ThinQ features comprehensive support of major high dynamic range formats including Dolby Vision, as well as HDR10 and HLG, both with LG’s advanced tone-mapping technology that provides scene-by-scene optimization

Dolby Atmos is the same audio technology developed for state-of-the-art cinemas, with immersive sound that appears to come from everywhere, putting you in the middle of all the excitement. Wide viewing angle

LG OLED Display uses the latest panels, with brighter, self-illuminating pixels that deliver perfect black and intense color. LG OLED TV with AI ThinQ brings movies, sports, games and more to thrilling new life
Inputs: 4 HDMI, 3 USB, 1 RF, 1 Composite in, 1 Ethernet, 1 Optical, 1 RS232C (Mini Jack) and Audio Return Channel Support via HDMI
Dimensions (Wx H x D): TV without stand 67.8" x 39" x 2.2", TV with stand: 67.8" x 41.4" x 10"

LG OLED Display uses the latest panels, with brighter, self-illuminating pixels that deliver perfect black and intense color. LG OLED TV with AI ThinQ brings movies, sports, games and more to thrilling new life
Inputs: 4 HDMI, 3 USB, 1 RF, 1 Composite in, 1 Ethernet, 1 Optical, 1 RS232C (Mini Jack) and Audio Return Channel Support via HDMI
Dimensions (Wx H x D): TV without stand 67.8" x 39" x 2.2", TV with stand: 67.8" x 41.4" x 10"

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars461 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
